indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Successful coordination of funding through the established the Somalia Development and Reconstruction Facility (SDRF).

baseline.comment: No coordinated funding facility in Somalia to enhance the delivery of effective assistance to all Somalis.

target.comment: Timely allocation of funds to the UNDP SDRF funded projects

actual.comment: Timely coordination of receipt of 7 contributions totalling USD 9,883,493.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 20,000 people to be reached through HIV Behaviour Change project (Community Conversations on HIV and HIV Radio message campaign) by end 2015

baseline.comment: At the end of 2015 approximately 11,000 people had been reached through Community Conversations on HIV

target.comment: Approximately 10,000 people reached with correct information on HIV and AIDS through Community Conversations on HIV being supported in HIV ‘Hot Spots’ and via 3 radio stations in Somalia

actual.comment: In Q2 745 (F: 581, M: 164) people participated in Community Conversation sessions on HIV, . In Q2 HIV radio massages broadcasted through local radio stations in the three zones (Radio Hargaisa, Radio SBC, Radio Mogadish, Radio Baidoa and Radio Garowe), the number of HIV massages aired were 1,362 massages., The overall listenership of these radios is estimated to be between 3 to 5 million people in FL, Somaliland and Puntland,

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Number of Land Use Policies and implementation roadmaps developed that support sustainable Natural Resources Management

baseline.comment: Land use policies and proper enforcement mechanisms on land-use do not exist in all zones of Somalia. This has led to conflicts over natural resources and exacerbated tensions between grazing nomadic pastoralists and sedentary agro-pastoralists. Rural populations are also using land in an ad-hoc manner, cutting trees to produce charcoal and encroaching on grazing lands.

target.comment: A Land Use Policy in each zone (Somaliland, Puntland and South Central) is initiated

actual.comment: 0 Concept notes prepared by the relevant government institutions in Puntland and Somaliland were approved and implementation of activities commenced to develop land use policies. South-Central regions to be covered through the Federal government in third quarter of 2015.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Output 1: - # of reconciliation conferences organized by IRAs/FGS - IRAs charters drafted through community/representatives consultation and feedback process - % of Women participating in reconciliation process/forums Output 2: Boundaries & Federation Commission (BFC) formation act is endorsed in parliament - % of women in BFC - % of members receive office equipment and tools to work - Refurbish and provide office equipment and tools for BFC office operation and support - Number of BFC members trained on framework and policy on Boundary and Federalism process. Output 3: - % of IRAs target population receive good governance and federalism messages - # of workshop/seminars/conferences conducted. Output 4: # of TA provided to MOIFA - % of Federal directorate receive office equipment support - # of MOIFA staff receive basic training to support federalism - # of Federal- interim consultative meets organized Output 5: % of Interim Regional Administration(IRA) receiving capacity building support - % of IRA staff trained in core functions area on basic service delivery process

target.comment:
Output 1: - At least two Reconciliation Conferences conducted towards state building process - Charters Drafted for each IRAs Output 2: - BFC is established based on FGS provisional constitution. - 20% women are members in BFC - 90% of BFC members receive required office equipment and tools to function Output 3: -In all IRAs good governance and federalism messages are broadcasted - At least two workshops/conferences are conducted. - One Regional development plan per IRA is developed. Output 4: - At least 35 MOIFA staff trained on governance and federalism - At least 6 consultative Meetings organized inclusive of PSG1 in regions - 70% of Federal directorate receive office equipment support
Output 5: - All four IRAs receive capacity building support. - 70% of IRA officials trained in basic management functions - Selected IRAs offices are rehabilitated

indicator.title: Output Indicator

actual.comment: 1. Three oversight missions conducted by Somaliland HoR Committees of Discipline, Socials affairs and Public accountss. Regional authorities and services contacted to investigate on security situation (Togdheer Region), enquire on provison of health and education services (Awadal), and the level of transparency and accountability at customs and revenue collection points to investigate (Awadal and Sanaag regions). 2. 640 MPs and their staff trained on developing agenda, parliamentary functions, orders of business etc. 3. A workshop on communication and outreach skills of MPs and constituency office staff 25 (M: 24 F: 1) conducted in Hargeisa. Using the skills gained during the first two days of the workshop, participants developed individual outreach action plans for each constituency office.

iati-activity.title: Electoral Assistance
iati-activity.description: SUPPORT TO THE INCLUSIVENESS AND TRANSPARENCY OF THE ELECTORAL PROCESS

Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Establishment of NIEC as a credible and capable government institution able to plan and conduct electoral operations in Somalia 2. The legal framework for electoral processes is in place 3. A 2016 electoral process (Parliament renewal) is developed and implemented 4. A coordination mechanism is in place between Government, UN, donors and electoral assistance providers to focused, effective and coherent international electoral assistance delivery

baseline.comment: 1. No recent history of national electoral processes in the Federal Republic of Somalia (no NIEC) 2. No legal framework in place for elections 3. Political ambiguity regarding upcoming national electoral processes (2016-2020). 4. A number of international electoral assistance providers are currently supporting the Federal government of Somalia and improved coordination is required

target.comment: 1. Appointment of NIEC Commissioners, physical establishment in place, institutional capacity development started 2. NIEC Law is passed 3. National Consultative Process is launched 4. Systematic coordination between electoral partners and stakeholders (Gov, donors, UN, electoral assistance providers)

actual.comment: 1. NIEC Commissioners have been appointed in July 2015. Through UNDP support, (temporary) offices have been established and equipment provided; capacity development efforts initiated (strategic planning, organizational development, electoral knowledge building). (NIEC Institutional Planning Workshops in Aug and October, BRIDGE training provided to MOIFA officials in August). 2. The NIEC Law has been passed by Parliament in February 2015. 3. On 19-21 September 2015, the National Consultative Process was launched. Between October and December, around 3,000 Somalis participated in national and regional consultative forums all over the country and in Nairobi for the diaspora to discuss an electoral option for the 2016 transition of federal parliament and state. 4. UNDP was strongly involved in coordination mechanisms with electoral partners and donors together with the NIEC during specific coordination sessions (Oct 2015) as well as (bi)monthly PSG1 (sub)working meetings on coordination of electoral processes.

location.activity-description: Construction of Health Center; Job Market Survey Capacity Development for Local Authority Counter Piracy Awareness Campain

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Increase in incomes, employment and diversified livelihood assets.

baseline.comment: 43% of Somalis live on less than $1/day, and 73% less than $2/day, unemployment stands at 48% and 80% of Somali households rely on natural resource-dependent activities for their livelihoods.

target.comment: Increased levels of income of 200 youth and women through provision of skills training, start-up tools and micro-grants, reduced levels of unemployment through provision of short term employment for at least another 650 youth and women involved in infrastructure rehabilitation works, as well as declining percentage of Somali households relying on natural resource-dependent activities such as charcoal burning.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
OUTPUT 1 Indicator 1: Number of new recruits (disaggregated by sex, location, institution, position) within public institutions supported by UNDP Indicator 2: Percentage of direct supervisors satisfied with new recruits
OUTPUT 2 Indicator 1: # of Civil Service Laws reviewed or amendments proposed Indicator 2: # of HR Management Framework submitted
OUTPUT 3 Indicator 1: # of Civil Service Training / Capacity Development Policy submitted Indicator 2: Number of Civil Service Training Institutes established Indicator 3: Number of trainings facilitated for civil servants Indicator 4: Number of consolidated reports produced from a consolidated tracking database for training provided to civil servants
OUTPUT 4 Indicator 1: Number of organizational / functional reviews carried out Indicator 2: Number of new organograms submitted for approval Indicator 3: Number of change management plans developed and submitted for approval Indicator 4: Number of institutions supported with infrastructure and equipment
OUTPUT 5 Indicator 1: Number of policy development guidelines developed Indicator 2: Number of proposals developed to clarify roles and responsibilities of individual government institutions Indicator 3: Number of inter-ministerial coordination meetings facilitated
OUTPUT 6 Indicator 1: Number of institutional coordination arrangements for development policy drafted Indicator 2: Number of Statistical Strategies reviewed, amended, updated or developed Indicator 3: Number of processes, tools and guidelines for collection and storage of data developed Indicator 4: # of Aid Coordination Architecture developed and institutionalized Indicator 5: Number of DAD/AIMS systems operational Indicator 6: Number of Quarterly reports on Aid Flows are generated through DAD/AIMS
OUTPUT 7 Indicator 1: Number of Project Board meetings are convened as scheduled Indicator 2: Number of Project progress reports generated periodically or monitored, reviewed and evaluated Indicator 3: Percenta

baseline.comment:
OUTPUT 1: Inidcator 1: 0 Indicator 2: 0
OUTPUT2: Indicator 1: None Indicator 2: None
OUTPUT 3: Indicator 1: 0 Indicator 2: Somaliland CSI existing since 2008 with UNDP support. In Federal and Puntland no operational CSI exist Indicator 3: 0 Indicator 4: None
OUTPUT 4: Indicator 1: 0 Indicator 2: 0 Indicator 3: 0 Indicator 4: During the previous SIDP project several institutions were supported
OUTPUT 5 Indicator 1: - Indicator 2: - Indicator 3: None
OUTPUT 6 Indicator 1: 0 Indicator 2: 0 Indicator 3: 0 Indicator 4: ACU on Federal level has been supported since mid2014. ACU activities in Puntland were starting in 2014. In Somaliland there is no dedicated ACU Indicator 5: A DAD system exists in Somalia but has not been operational in practice Indicator 6: DAD allows on demand report production

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Number of regions that adopt quota system for women 2. Number of women that contest in national elections supported by UNDP. 3. Number of electoral policies that mainstream gender equality

baseline.comment: 1. No quotas for women in all 3 regions. 2. Data on women candidates for electoral offices at national level not available 3. No gender mainstreamed electoral policies

target.comment: At least 5 media stories on women in the private sector 10 private sector companies advocated adopting gender-sensitive policies and recruiting women.

actual.comment:
The media training on Gender was held in Uganda from 14th to 17th September.The media training on gender aims to equip key leaders of media industry ( journalists, reporters and media owners) in different regions, 11 from Federal Government, 15 from Puntland and 3 from Somaliland to a better understanding of gender equality issues in media reporting and strengthen their ability to investigate and develop reports and stories on gender and women’s issues Somali Women entrepreneurs were supported to participate in the Somali Investment Forum in Nairobi from the 8th to 10th March 2015. The event brought together Somali entrepreneurs, investors, sector experts, business development experts and other stakeholders – all of whom are focused on Somalia – to discuss Somali investing and seeks to catalyze business growth by bringing Diaspora investor and entrepreneurs and other stakeholders together to engage in a series of practical call to action events. There has been specific session on Women Entrepreneurs structured along the study on the role of women in the private sector recommendations commissioned by UNDP in 2014. UNDP GEWE has been privileged to present the findings of the private sector study. Gender project conducted meetings with 30 women from CSOs to explore the best strategies of promoting gender parity in the Somalia CO and recommended to reconvene after 6 months to measure the progressive of gender parity in Somalia and how the insights of these meetings are being applied by UNDP in order to ensure 50/50 gender parity in its staff. The follow up meeting will be held in Q3 to review the progressive change of gender parity in UNDP staff. In Puntland and Somaliland, the project continued to support young women tertiary scholarship recipients (30 in PL and 29 SL). Tuition fees, transportation and text book allowances were provided to the students to peruse the first semester of their third academic year.
At federal level, the Ministry of Education was enga

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - Systems in place to allocate and distribute resources for stabilization - Number of district and federal level entities with recruited staff to support stabilization efforts

target.comment: - Systems in place to allocate and distribute resources for stabilization - 5 district and 1 federal level entities with recruited staff to support stabilization efforts

actual.comment:
11- The financial procedures for the distribution of resources which were included as an annex of the project document have been reviewed and adjusted to project implementation reality. Payments are being made to 11 districts.
24 district staff - At district level, 11 CLOs (F: 2; M: 9) and 13 LGAs (F: 1; M: 12), 1 of each for each target district, were recruited and trained in 13 districts
5 staff (F:2; M:3) at MoIFA (FGS) level were recruited and are operational.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1.1.1 # of decentralization or local governance-related policies that are developed (or drafted) 2.1.1 # of districts that have systems in place to increase revenue generation (e.g. property taxes, business licensing, etc.) 2.2.1 # of municipal staff trained in at least one PEM module (but up to 5) 2.2.2 # of district council members trained in civic education, public management, procurement and etc

target.comment: Local Government Institute conceptual and operational framework developed and agreed among stakeholders At least one decentralization dialogues organized in new states
